The Funklet
The Unknown Drummer, “Str Bts DC Gogo 100” Bernard Purdie, “Hot Sweat” Narada Michael Walden, “Come Dancing” James Gadson, “Use Me” Zigaboo Modeliste, “Cissy Strut” Clyde Stubblefield, “Mother Popcorn” Clyde Stubblefield, “I Got the Feelin'”

The Funklet?

Every drummer on this website has great feel — duh. Beyond feel, they are also reat composers.

Think of the drums set as a three key piano. Instead of strings, the hammers hit tubular wooden shells covered with stretched animal hides. Actually, just think of a drum set.

These beats are clever melodic phrases that translate across different timbers. You can play “Yesterday” on the oboe. You can play “Cold Sweat” on an 808. Dig?

If you are looking for more anecdotes and technical advice, check out Jim Payne’s The Drummers Some! and Stanton Moore’s Groove Alchemy, respectively.

Enjoy the website. I enjoy making it. If you anything creative with the beats you find here, let me know.
